fields.description:
Good evening!

I and my team have problems with pushing data to my repository here: https://bitbucket.org/santaux/indeal

It gives us a message:

"conq: the account owner 'santaux' has exceeded their user limit - write access is disabled to the repository 'indeal'.\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly"

I have only 2 users (and me) with write access. Why they can't push data here?

fields.description:
I've just merge multiple branches from a private repo and now when clicking on files in the repos i'm received a 500 error...

the id of the error was the following:

5b7b224461b241f5b6d0631ccb87ae31$e41e3018e33299cb8ac3714c60b39d5a

fields.description:
We're getting the following on new repos:

fatal: 'halusagn@bitbucket.org/swpg/nonb_2.git' does not appear to be a git repository
fields.summary: New Repo: fatals

fields.description:
It would be nice to see comments made on particular commits in the pull request file view.

Our workflow is:  Create pull request incorporating commits.  Add comments to the pull request (line-by-line).  Address comments in new commit, add new commit to pull request.

But then if the reviewer wants to comment on the changes in the commit, those comments don't show up anywhere in the pull request (neither the activity stream or the file viewer).  And there's no way to see changes relative to the last commit in the pull request directly.  So there's no way to comment on just the changes made since the last review.

This feature would really help smooth out our workflow.
fields.summary: View commit comments in pull request.

fields.description:
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
79aec78856334f08be4406a9d2aff0be$dffc00d3524eed0dafc08fd3f2c06501

Tried several times to comment/add attachment (image) through edit issue, but all the times I got the 500 error page.

The attachment is succesfully uploaded, but the comment is lost
fields.summary: Commenting and adding attachments to an issue causes 500 error

fields.description:
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
79aec78856334f08be4406a9d2aff0be$dffc00d3524eed0dafc08fd3f2c06501

Tried several times to comment/add attachment (image) through edit issue, but all the times I got the 500 error page.

The attachment is succesfully uploaded, but the comment is lost
fields.summary: Commenting and adding attachments to an issue causes 500 error

fields.description:
One of our pull requests ([PR12 of telemetris account|https://bitbucket.org/telemetris/tqr/pull-request/12/]) concerns 100 files.

Only the 68 first diffs are displayed, while all remaining files diffs have to be displayed manually by clicking on: {{This diff was too big for us to render on page load. Click here to try to load it}}

This wouldn't be an issue, if these manually displayed diffs could be commented:

# Go to pull request page.
# Scroll to files list, and click on a file in the end of the list.
# The diff of the selected file is displayed.
# Click to display the "Add comment" form.
# Input a comment.
# Click on the "Comment" button.

* *Expected result*: The new comment is added to the file diff.
* *Result*: Nothing happens: 500 error is raised: {{POST https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/telemetris/tqr/pullrequests/12/comments/ 500 INTERNAL SERVER ERROR 6.7s}}
fields.summary: Cannot comment on diff that wasn't displayed because the pull request has lots of files (BB-7787)

fields.description:
I use BitBucket with DeployHQ and Flowdock.\\
When we push to BitBucket, it notifies both service for a build and a notification.

I noticed that if I merge a branch together on SourceTree and push it back to Bitbucket, BitBucket will fire off events to webhooks with branch name as "null".

You can see from the screenshot of Flowdock. If it's a new commit, it is fine (dev branch in screenshot) but when I merge the changes into other branch and push, Flowdock will report as null...

DeployHQ also uses the branch info to trigger build for different branches... so it doesn't know which branch to build when I merge.
fields.summary: Branch Merger Trigger Webhook with no Branch Info

fields.description:
"I wanted to submit this Hall.com broker class and request that Hall be added to the list of bitbucket service integrations.

Let us know what other information you may need to move forward or if anything needs to change in the broker file.\\
The only field we require the user to provide is room_token. We handle the rest on our end.

Thanks so much! We're really excited to provide Bitbucket integration for all of our customers!."
fields.summary: Hall.com Broker Request (BB-7782)

fields.description:
Just like pull requests and issues have filters, it would be nice if the newsfeed/overview had filtering. F.ex.:

* my repos
* followed repos
* followed people

Currently the main newsfeed stacks together important updates about repositories I work with and less relevant updates about somebody following somebody else's repo.
fields.summary: dashboard newsfeed filters

fields.description: How about including it in the list of languages?

fields.description:
On the overview page for a repository (in our case ThapLtd/ClicksControlV2) we accidentally pushed changes that included a large binary file, this forced the project info size to update.

Since then we're stripped the offending change set from local/bitbucket repository and have since done a few more pushes, however the size hasn't been recalculated.
fields.summary: Mercurial repository size accuracy

fields.description:
I have the following folder structure.

{code}
Image.png
Folder1
   Readme.md
Folder2
   Readme.md  
{code}

Inside Folder1/Readme.md I have:

{code}
   ![MY_COOL_IMAGE](../Image.png)
   [MY_OTHER_README](../Folder2/Readme.md)
{code}

Shouldn't this work?
fields.summary: Markdown relative link to image and other readme does not work

fields.description: Would it be possible to *Not*  get an email when I create a issue,  but still get emails if somebody replies  to the issue.
fields.summary: Email when creating an issue

fields.description:
I am a member of a team. That team has many repositories - only a subset of which I am particularly interested in at any particular time. I would therefore like email notifications (particularly from the issue tracker) from only this subset and not the rest. Could this fine grained control of email notifications please be added as a feature?

Cheers,\\
Tim
fields.summary: Per repository email notification settings

fields.description:
Currently, if a repository is deleted, and pull requests that have been issued from that repository upstream are lost.  Any comments, code review and so on that were left are no longer accessible, even if the pull request (and thus the changesets that constituted it and that were commented on) has been accepted.

Having the ability to retain these comments puts control back in the upstream repository, where the comments are issued from, where the pull request is listed, etc etc.  Even if only the accepted pull requests are allowed to persist, it would be an enormous improvement.  Right now, this can be very problematic for projects that do code review.
fields.summary: Merged PRs fail to render diff when the source repo is deleted (BB-7778)

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

For my "Core" repo (and several others) "Kim Gressens" used to be a team member.

I removed all his privileges on these repos but now want to invite him again.

When I try to invite him to several repos, BB says that he's already a member... however Kim cannot access the repos anymore...

Kim should off course no get access to all my repos(!)

Kind regards,

* Dirk
fields.summary: Cannot invite follower?

fields.description: I tried this with newest versions of Opera on Windows and Linux. Pressing F does nothing. Firefox and Rekonq works ok but I want to use Opera :)
fields.summary: Quick file search not working on Opera
Private wiki clone URL is missing username (BB-7769)

fields.description:
Since March 5th , 2013 I've been experiencing issues with my private project

https://olemis@bitbucket.org/olemis/03dzyx

First I tried to pull changes and this is what I got

{code}
#!sh

$ hg pull bb_temp
http authorization required
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP
user: olemis
password: 
pulling from https://olemis@bitbucket.org/olemis/03dzyx
searching for changes
abort: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error

{code}

I created a second fork hoping that this could be a _local_ file system issue but this is what I got

{code}
#!sh

$ hg pull bb_temp
http authorization required
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP
user: olemis
password: 
pulling from https://olemis@bitbucket.org/olemis/03dzyx_temp
searching for changes
abort: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error

{code}

Finally I thought this all could be about problematic changesets . Therefore I decided to strip some of them . First attempt @ b8fba9d and second one @ c02a3d8 both failed .

By looking at the repos history it seems that push is still working .

No hope I ended up with a useless repository and my team is frozen waiting for this to be fixed .

Q:

* Is it a known bug ?
* Is there any hope to get this sorted out soon ?
* Or shall we consider to abandon Bitbucket and look for something else ?\\
If so how could we migrate the repository if we cannot read it ?

PS: I'm hoping my selection of ticket field values will accurately reflect the nature of this issue .
fields.summary: 03dzyx - HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error

fields.description:
Allow user to migrate all the git repos from their GitHub account with one button (plus credentials)

Minimum: Clone repos, preserve private/public setting

Nice to have: Issues, remap user email?,.....
fields.summary: Support "Migrate Account repos from GitHub" button (BB-6747)

fields.description:
Currently, I cannot find any way to disable e-mail notifications on a per-project basis.

I am one of the administrators for our team, so I have admin access to all team repositories, but this means I receive a sea of e-mail for projects that I do not need to track on a regular basis. It would be very nice to be able to disable this on a per-project basis (perhaps even with a default-off option, and of course only affecting my notifications from that project) so I can have finer-grained control over the e-mails that I receive from BitBucket.
fields.summary: Allow e-mail notification to be disabled per-project/user combo (BB-7494)

fields.description:
We are currently running 1.6RC1.

Do we have 1.6 planned for release?
fields.summary: Pygments v1.6 (BB-7760)

fields.description: Please show all the open issues for my repositories on the dashboard, even if I'm not watching or assignee.
fields.summary: show my repositories' issues on the dashboard

fields.description: The dashboard issues list does not show issues from site/master.
fields.summary: site/master issues do not show on dashboard (BB-7786)

fields.description:
Project managers need to have a view of all tickets so they can keep an eye on what is happening in the production teams.

They will not be creating all the tickets so they won't know they exist to be able to watch them. Of course they also will not be assigned to every ticket so they cannot see it that way either.

So it would be fantastic if a user was able to see a view of all tickets in a specified team rather than just those that are created by you, assigned to you or watched by you.

I currently have a little PHP hack that hits the API every 5 minutes and downloads every ticket it can find for every project it can find for a particular team we have about 110 repositories and growing). Obviously this is highly inefficient and uses copious amounts of Bitbucket's bandwidth and ours so it would be great if this could be removed.

The new dashboard is excellent and goes a long way to resolving our major issues, but there is this last sticking point that it would be great to see fixed.

Please the following Twitter exchange for more information: https://twitter.com/Treffynnon/status/308904841961410563
fields.summary: View new/open issues of all team repos on dashboard (BB-7761)

fields.description:
Hello,

I've found the issue which seems to be almost the same, but it's closed and I cannot find a way to change a target branch to merge pull request in.

Link: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3369/allow-pull-request-receiver-to-change

To reproduce:

# Create a public repository "A" with branches master, features
# Create a new user, fork the "A" with a new public one (let it be "B")
# Make some changes in the "B"
# Create a pull request to the "A", select branch master
# Log in with the administrator of the "A"
# Check your "Pull requests" - there is no chance to edit the target branch (it's set to "master" as the user selected). If you press "Merge", all the changes will be merged into master.

At the same time, the user who creates pull request do have a chance to specify a branch to merge request into.

It would be perfect if there is a chance to merge pull requests into custom branches, may be it should be created during pull request acceptance. It seems to be very useful in case of code review with fisheye+crucible, for example - you can merge the request into a branch, create a review in your crucible system, make some testing and then merge into master if needed.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Allow pull request receiver to change destination branch #2

fields.description:
I've tried to embed BitBucket in Zoho as an application, but numerous features die since it appears that you are trying to access the top level document instead of your parent document.

Zoho embeds BitBucket in an IFRAME.  When I got to some places (like account administration) I get the following error from chrome:

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'replace' of undefined f48c93f171ac.js:1388\\
Unsafe JavaScript attempt to access frame with URL https://mail.zoho.com/biz/index.do from frame with URL https://bitbucket.org/account/user/drakmir/email/. The frame being accessed set 'document.domain' to 'zoho.com', but the frame requesting access did not. Both must set 'document.domain' to the same value to allow access.

This is obviously as expected, but it means that bitbucket can't be "embedded" into other applicaitons.  I'd love for this to be fixed.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Embed BitBucket in Zoho

fields.description:
Hello!

I've just got 500 error while trying to view my "Pull Requests" tab.

A problem seems to be reproduced in the following way:

# Create user
# Fork some public repository (let it be "A") into "B"
# Make some changes in "B"
# Create a "Pull Request" with the changes you made
# Start "Pull Request" review with the administrator / admin grop of the "A" repository
# Delete user created at step 1.

After that you have polling "Pull Request" in your repository "A", but you cannot see it because of a 500 error.

Debugging hash: b12a95a8e37d4e62b0b82b092f8193ec$a2fa515e48c169ba316d5696bb5c5ede

Thank you!
fields.summary: 500 Error while accessing "Pull requests" (BB-7759)

fields.description:
The README.rst tends to format poorly. Most notably, the TOC's header ("Contents") renders too close to preceding text, and the H3 header has no top margin which also makes it render too close to preceding text.

For example, take a look at the [overview tab of one of my projects|https://bitbucket.org/brankovukelic/django-url-tools/overview].

If I did not pass in start=0, it will work just fine.

fields.description:
Reviewers are complaining there's no "reject" button on PRs.

Need to support a flow where a reviewer can easily show they don't want a PR, noting they must be able to update that later.

Possibly, all review/reject marks need to be reset after a PR is updated, too.
fields.summary: Need a "reject" as well as "approve" (BB-7750)

fields.description:
If I create a feature branch in a (Mercurial) fork, and want to merge it into the default branch on the upstream repository, I cannot ask that the branch be closed when the pull request is merged.

Our development workflow is to do all WIP work in personal forks, and only merge to the master repository when done. Feature branches in these WIP forks are useful, though, when someone is working on multiple features/fixes.
fields.summary: Feature branches in forks cannot be closed in a pull request (BB-7747)

fields.description:
OAuth does not return a key or id for a particular user.  After authenticating I'm getting back something like this for my own account..

{ "username": "lipis", "first_name": "Panayiotis", "last_name": "Lipiridis", "display_name": "Panayiotis Lipiridis", "is_team": False, "avatar": "https://secure.grav...", "resource_uri": "/1.0/users/lipis" }

But since you can change the username (I did that for example) it's\\
not good for my own application if that particular user going to user\\
Bitbucket login again. I need something more unique and unchangeable\\
from your side so I'll be able to associate that in my internal\\
database.
fields.summary: Return a user key/id from the user rest endpoint (BB-7739)
External wiki links broken after 100 items (BB-7762)

fields.description:
Hello,

A short while back I wrote a broker for Weblate. I didn't want to submit\\
it before the Bitbucket hook was actually available on Weblate too. But\\
it is now!

So: https://bitbucket.org/Freso/weblate-bitbucket-broker

If you need to make any changes to it, I'd appreciate it if you submit\\
pull requests I can pull in. Also, feel free to point people to the\\
project/repository for an example of a broker that's out in the open.

–\\
Namasté,\\
Frederik "Freso" S. Olesen [http://freso.dk/]
fields.summary: Add broker for Weblate (BB-7735)

fields.description:
Hi - thanks for adding reviewers to pull requests, that's a really useful feature!

However, it would be even more useful if the notification emails that are issued by a pull request included the name of the reviewer near the top, e.g.,

A new pull request has been opened by Joe Bloggs.\\
Reviewers: John Smith, Jane Smith.

Otherwise if you are following the repository you have to open the pull request to find out who the intended reviewer is.

Thanks.

--KW 8-)
fields.summary: Reviewer name should appear in notification email (BB-7745)

fields.description: It would be nice if the "email diff" service offered an option to plainly send one email per commit, and not aggregate several commits into one email (which is rather confusing to read).

fields.description:
I have a project that requires allowing members of an organisation to download the contents of a private repository via a script, I was hoping I would be able to use bitbucket and access the download links with oauth credentials, but this does not appear to be possible currently.

I would like to use my oauth credentials to access the following uri's on private repositories.

https://bitbucket.org/{user}/{repo}/get/{branch,tag}.{zip,tar.gz,tar.bz}

github currently supports this feature and their API docs for it can be found here, but as a mercurial user thats not really an option for me:

http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/

they appear to have an endpoint that generates short lived token with access to the download.
fields.summary: Download tar / zip with oauth api token

fields.description:
After you created a repository on Bitbucket, and you click your newly created repository, you receive a message like:

Import an existing repository

* You already have a Git repository on your computer. Let's publish it to Bitbucket.\\
cd /path/to/my/repo\\
git remote add origin ssh://git@bitbucket.org/Locolabo/schoenen-lorenz.git\\
git push -u origin --all   # to push changes for the first time

But In my case, I'm new to git, so the above command didn't work.\\
Here it is simply explained how to get started from scratch easely:

http://www.thebuzzmedia.com/git-tip-git-push-no-refs-in-common-and-none-specified/comment-page-1/#comment-574083

Kind regards,\\
LocoLabo
fields.summary: "Get Started"

fields.description:
Diffstat always reports null lines added on an added file.

h2. How to reproduce
* View [commit|https://bitbucket.org/cheryl/test-git/commits/49087aaf62c7c81262d46503d379c562] that has one file added, with one line added (even says so in the UI "Files changed" section)
* Visit http://restbrowser.bitbucket.org/
* GET https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/cheryl/test-git/changesets/49087aa/diffstat

h3. Actual result
[\\
{\\
"type": "added",\\
"file": "testfile.txt",\\
"diffstat": {\\
"removed": null,\\
"added": null\\
}\\
}\\
]

h3. Expected result
[\\
{\\
"type": "added",\\
"file": "testfile.txt",\\
"diffstat": {\\
"removed": 0,\\
"added": 1\\
}\\
}\\
]
fields.summary: API - diffstat wrong results

fields.description:

It would be even nicer to be able to list all the "pending" comments when updating the pull request, with checkboxes to mark them as resolved by the update.

Please, restore old behaviour.

fields.description: When your master branch is empty, Bitbucket loads a helpful template instructing users to make their "first commit." However, as I use git flow and frequently may not have anything in the master branch for some time until I produce a first release -- this means it is not at all easy to access my source code online in the browser under a different branch. The toggle button to switch between branches (e.g. to the develop branch) is only visible when you are navigating the master branch's source code; it is not visible on the template page instructing to make your "first commit".  If you haven't uploaded any source code to the master branch, you do not see the toggle button to switch to a different branch that may have code. See attached PNG image.
fields.summary: Can't access non-master branch when master is empty

fields.description:

fields.summary: Error 500

fields.description:
When I add a submodule in my repo like this:

git submodule add https://user@bitbucket.org/user/submodulerepo.git

In my .gitmodules file the url parameter ends with a trailing .git extension, wich causes clicking in submodule link in the source browser in bitbucket to end in a 404 page.

Adding the submodule without the .git extension solves this problem

git submodule add https://user@bitbucket.org/user/submodulerepo

I don't know if this is the default behaviour or if it is a bug. I used to work with github and when I open the URL github.com/user/repo.git it redirects me to github.com/user/repo

Cheers!
fields.summary: Working with git submodules (BB-7717)

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:\\
I just made a push that included two commits.\\
On the page /overview, in section Recent Activity\\
The recent activity is shown with Latest First.

Actual:\\
However, these two commits (that were in the one push) are listed Oldest First under my name in the Recent Activity List.

Expected:\\
Please make also that list Latest First, to avoid confusion.

Compare:\\
Compare with the page /commits/all\\
Where all commits are correctly listed Latest First

Please View side-by-side screen shots, attached.

Specific Pages:\\
https://bitbucket.org/bridgethillyer/physics-toy/overview\\
https://bitbucket.org/bridgethillyer/physics-toy/commits/all

Specifc Commits (in expected order, Latest First):\\
Author	Commit	MessageLabelsCommentsApprovals	Date\\
Martin Dahlborg	2d33b26	Updated: Some file names, Added...	yesterday\\
Martin Dahlborg	829ff6e	Adding our names to (c)	yesterday

Thank you,\\
Martin Dahlborg, Code@MartinDahlborg.com
fields.summary: Overview-Recent Activity: Please display commits in same push with latest first

fields.description:
The 'likes'  api, as described in the documentation, always returns a 404.  For example:

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/atlassian/remotable-plugins/changesets/f50e4672429df3e238bde6c949adae14c92528dc

exists and allows /comments but

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/atlassian/remotable-plugins/changesets/f50e4672429df3e238bde6c949adae14c92528dc/likes

fails with a 404.
fields.summary: Likes REST API returns a 404

fields.description:
The new reviewer feature looks neat, but I can't locate one of my team members.  I've tried their full name, userid, etc and can't find the correct user.

It's a common name, so I'm guessing the search is being limited on the backend and the correct hit is dropped.

As a result, I can't assign them as a reviewer - which in my mind breaks the feature so I prioritized as major.

Suggestions:

* always list exact matches for user names
* prioritize teammates for repositories that are private, and/or have team ownership
* limit searches for private repositories (I see this option is already a feature request)
fields.summary: Reviewer search fails to find teammate

fields.description:
Would love the option to be able to select who receives email notifications on an issue by issue basis. Similar to how Basecamp allows you to select people whom to email. This would be helpful as not all issues require an email notification to the whole team, and it just adds to cluttered inboxes.

See basecamp example here - http://cl.ly/image/0g1L100f1k2A
fields.summary: Issue Tracker Email Notification Selection Option (BB-7713)

fields.description:
[Our project's overview page|https://bitbucket.org/redfin/main] used to list the author of each commit that went into our repo, but now it lists instead the user who pushed the commit. Unfortunately for us, those aren't the same person, and the pusher is kind of useless.

Right now we're checking in to SVN and then using git-svn to sync to bitbucket (as part of our svn --> git migration). The script that pushes to bitbucket runs as one of our users, so all pushes come from the same person, even though they are authored by many different people.

I can understand why you want to be precise about identifying who pushed the commit in the overview feed, but that's not useful info for us. Can we at least have an option to show the author instead, as the overview used to?
fields.summary: The overview page for our repo now lists the person who pushed rather than the person who authored commits (BB-7712)

fields.description: I just attempted to fork illumos/illumos-gate at revision dc1b5bc72558 to my local gwr/il-ncp3-brand repo and the new repo is empty.  Something bad happened...
fields.summary: fork at specific revision produced an empty repository

fields.description:
Searching repositories by name on custom domain gives auto-completition, but URLs are not valid as are relative to bitbucket.org domain.

For example, I have domain [code.rreverser.com|http://code.rreverser.com/]. When I type "bmp" into search box, I get correct auto-completition list and choose, for example, "oov/php-bmp". I expect it to redirect to repository page ([http://bitbucket.org/oov/php-bmp|http://bitbucket.org/oov/php-bmp]) but instead getting redirected to [http://code.rreverser.com/oov/php-bmp|http://code.rreverser.com/oov/php-bmp] and, of course, getting 404 error here.
fields.summary: Search on custom domain doesn't work (BB-7711)

fields.description:
When I visit this URL to view all commits: https://bitbucket.org/locusdevelopment/locus-web-curation/commits/all

They are in the correct order (most recent on top).

When I click on one commit, and then press the back button, they are no longer in the correct order, and I need to refresh the page.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Commits view in a repo goes out of order

fields.description:
In case that title isn't clear, here's what I did:

a.) in a PR, add a comment on a line. click the submit button\\
b.) while the spinner is going and the comment hasn't fully submitted, click another line to add a comment\\
c.) the mid-submission comment field will jump down to the new line; it will still submit correctly, though, on the line where it was originally submitted (as refreshing the page confirms). Editing the comment while it's in the incorrect location still edits the comment at the other location; for all purposes except the display before refreshing the page, the comment is at the original location.
fields.summary: pull requests: clicking a new line to add a comment while a previous comment is still submitting incorrectly moves the previous comment field (but not the actual comment) (BB-7701)

fields.description: I'm guessing this is probably a duplicate issue, but it would be really helpful to be able to take action on all items in my inbox. It's awesome that the recent update stops future spam, but I have 1,500 messages in my inbox from before and I'm not going to go through and delete them 15 at a time.
fields.summary: Take action on ALL messages in inbox (BB-6937)

fields.description:
Pull requests for our repo at ziadev/alfresco-mobile seem to be generating way too many email notifications since the change a day or so ago.

I have had a couple of complaints from watchers that they are suddenly receiving many more notifications. These are watchers that have no write access to the repo, so shouldn't be matching the "watching and writeable" rule you mention in the recent blog post.

Is this is known issue? I couldn't see any other people mentioning it, so maybe it's some setting on our repo that we need to update?

Many thanks,\\
Mike
fields.summary: Too many pull request notifications being sent out

fields.description:
When go to [https://www.bitbucket.org/izi/django-admin-tools/downloads/django-admin-tools-0.4.1.tar.gz|https://www.bitbucket.org/izi/django-admin-tools/downloads/django-admin-tools-0.4.1.tar.gz]. I get redirected to the homepage.

It should instead redirect me to the same page, just without the "www" subdomain.

This seems to cause issues with the python pip installer, which uses the www subdomain on its links for package downloads, at least for the above example.

Mike - mike@mikemonteith.com
fields.summary: www subdomain redirects
